intro: Bupleurum flavicans var. karglioides, commonly known as the Kargli yellow bell, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Himalayas. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic compounds and often branched stems. The plant produces small, yellow flowers arranged in umbels, which bloom in the summer months. It thrives in rocky and alpine environments, often found in meadows and slopes at elevations above 3,000 meters. Its leaves are pinnate and have a distinctive, slightly hairy texture, contributing to its adaptability in harsh mountain climates.
